Authors: Luhukay D., Kurniawan Y., Trisnio K., Prasetyo A., Pricensia C., Putra E., Famadi S.
Title: Development of ONCOM (Online Community) platform: A conceptual model
Source title: International Journal of Mechanical Engineering and Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Luhukay, D., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Trisnio, K., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prasetyo, A., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pricensia, C., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putra, E., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Famadi, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information System, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to know and analyse community needs based on current situation and condition, we designing community portal to support information requirement about member registration, member data, community data and event data from a community and to know how a community portal can help storage and the delivery of information about user and event data required can be available quickly and accurately for the members of the community portal. The method used by the author is literature and field study. The author uses the field method to conduct interviews and conduct surveys to find supporting data that helps in the development of information systems portal community. Based on the results of the study, it was found that the designed community portal can help to know the business process of one of the existing community at this time, to help facilitate the community in managing new user candidates as well as old user and event data that has been going on and will take place and facilitate the community in doing storage and delivery of information to users quickly and accurately. © IAEME Publication.

Authors: Kosasih W., Kurniawan Y., Cassandra C., Trisnio K.
Title: Learning Simulation Design Using Social Media Facebook
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Business School Doctor of Research in Management Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kosasih, W., Management Department, BINUS Business School Doctor of Research in Management Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kurniawan, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Cassandra, C., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Trisnio, K., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: E-Learning has become the most popular learning method in educational field due to the growth of Internet technologies. One of the E-Learning is Social Learning that can use social media as a learning media. This research discusses the use of social media Facebook as a learning media. The benefits of this research for educators are expected to give feedback for them on the use of social media Facebook in addition to learn activities, whereas for non-regular students, with the use of social media Facebook as a learning media it can increase the motivation of students in learning activities. The main objective of this research is to provide recommendations for the learning model that can improve the learning motivation of non-regular students. Methods of data collection use observation, literature study, and questionnaires given to 80 respondents in the category of non-regular students and the analysis of data use Microsoft Excel. From the analysis results it can be concluded that most of students choose social media as additional learning media. Hence authors design a learning model using social media Facebook. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: E-learning; Information management; Motivation; Students; Surveys; Facebook; Internet technology; Learning Activity; Learning motivation; Learning simulation; Literature studies; Methods of data collections; non-regular; Social networking (online)
